projects.title: Learning from Reward-Free Offline Data: A Case for Planning with Latent Dynamics Models
projects.description: A study analyzing RL and control-based methods for learning from offline datasets without reward annotations. The research evaluates dataset properties affecting performance, showcasing the advantages of planning with latent dynamics models.

projects.title: Eidetic Learning: an Efficient and Provable Solution to Catastrophic Forgetting
projects.description: This paper introduces Eidetic Learning, a method that eliminates catastrophic forgetting in neural networks without requiring rehearsal. The approach ensures efficient and scalable learning across successive tasks.

projects.title: Curvature Tuning: Provable Training-free Model Steering From a Single Parameter
projects.description: Curvature Tuning (CT) is a training-free method for model steering that modulates decision boundary curvature using a single parameter. This efficient approach enhances generalization and robustness across downstream tasks.

projects.title: No Location Left Behind: Measuring and Improving the Fairness of Implicit Representations for Earth Data
projects.description: FAIR-Earth is a dataset designed to evaluate biases in Earth representation models. The study highlights disparities in modeling specific geographic features and proposes spherical wavelet encodings to improve fairness and accuracy.

projects.title: Beyond and Free from Diffusion: Invertible Guided Consistency Training
projects.description: This work proposes an invertible guided consistency training approach that removes the need for costly diffusion model distillation, enabling efficient and flexible guidance in image generation.

projects.title: Beyond [cls]: Exploring the True Potential of Masked Image Modeling Representations
projects.description: This paper investigates the performance gap between Masked Image Modeling (MIM) and Joint-Embedding Architectures (JEA) by analyzing the information flow in Vision Transformers.

projects.title: Self-Supervised Video Instance Segmentation Can Boost Geographic Entity Alignment in Historical Maps
projects.description: This research explores the use of self-supervised video instance segmentation to improve the alignment of geographic entities across historical maps, facilitating cultural heritage studies.

projects.title: Cross-Entropy Is All You Need To Invert the Data Generating Process
projects.description: This paper explores how cross-entropy loss enables supervised models to learn interpretable factors of variation and invert the data-generating process.

projects.title: The Fair Language Model Paradox
projects.description: This study examines token-level biases in large language models, revealing structural disparities introduced by training dynamics and hyperparameter choices.

projects.title: ALLoRA: Adaptive Learning Rate Mitigates LoRA Fatal Flaws
projects.description: This work identifies core limitations in LoRA fine-tuning and introduces an adaptive learning rate mechanism to enhance its efficiency.

projects.title: Self-Supervised Anomaly Detection in the Wild: Favor Joint Embeddings Methods
projects.description: This paper evaluates self-supervised learning approaches for anomaly detection, emphasizing the effectiveness of joint embedding methods.

projects.title: UniBench: Visual Reasoning Requires Rethinking Vision-Language Beyond Scaling
projects.description: This research introduces UniBench, a systematic evaluation framework for vision-language models to better assess meaningful axes of progress.

projects.title: On the Geometry of Deep Learning
projects.description: This paper provides an overview of deep learning through the lens of affine spline mappings, revealing key geometric insights.

projects.title: X-Sample Contrastive Loss: Improving Contrastive Learning with Sample Similarity Graphs
projects.description: This paper introduces X-Sample Contrastive Loss, an approach that enhances contrastive learning by incorporating sample similarity graphs.
